pages.title: Field Notes · Page I — Rampart lattice schematics.

content.text: Sketches annotate the sigil-laced ramparts and note the protective harmonics woven into each parapet.
Margin scribbles highlight mote vents—the primer you will use to calibrate your first defenses.

pages.title: Field Notes · Page II — Powder flow resonance studies.

content.text: Diagrams catalog each powder flow experiment. Arrows track the resonance curves as motes crash against containment runes.
Annotations flag combinations that amplify mote yields when synchronized with Chronoglyph wards.

pages.title: Field Notes · Page III — Counter-formation annotations.

content.text: Enemy formations are paired with counter-formulae. Follow the mirrored glyphs to see where to fracture each proof.
Notations in crimson warn of harmonics that can collapse the tower's lattice if left unattended.

pages.title: Field Notes · Page IV — Warden briefing.

content.text: Welcome, Warden. I am Thero, archivist of the glyph lattice. Your arrival coincides with a surge of mote turbulence washing against the tower's perimeter.
Our scouts report that rival scholars have animated rogue proofs. Each wave they summon is tuned to unravel the equations binding our defenses. Hold these observations close:

pages.title: Field Notes · Page V — Defense directives.

items: The Scintilla Glyph at the summit regulates every mote current—lose it and the lattice collapses.
Chronoglyph wards along the ramparts can bend time briefly. Use their cadence to reset your ordinals and stagger enemy advances.
When a wave fractures, sift the motes it leaves behind. Their resonance seeds new towers faster than any quarry.

content.text: Return once the next theorem is secured. I will inscribe your progress and prepare the following expedition. The codex grows because of your vigilance.
